channel.title: Shortening system.out.println

item.title: Shortening system.out.println
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:20, topic:424692”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=527356.msg3844073#msg3844073 date=1323476158]
Why the hell would you want to? It’s god damn confusing.
[/quote][/quote]

And for the OP;

private void print(String s) { System.out.println(s); }

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

If I say I’m doing a RSPS then I’m “doing Java” is what I was effectively saying.

item.title: Shortening system.out.println
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“The Outsider, post:30, topic:424692”][quote author=runescape sucks link=topic=527356.msg3844228#msg3844228 date=1323484258]

I try to keep rsps away from java, as rsps is a disgrace to java, seeing as how badly MOST servers are horribly programmed, such as delta, but their are few good ones, such as apollo.

Well, I do enjoy coding Java more than RSPS, but i like the sM thing because it’s very short and for me easy to remember as i used to make Delta based servers constantly
[/quote]
RSPS is not a language. RuneScape Private Servers are written in Java (98% of the time). RSPS/Java are effectively the same thing.[/quote]
Runescape Private Servers are written in Java, the language.

Read full topic

item.title: Shortening system.out.println
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“The Outsider, post:30, topic:424692”][quote author=runescape sucks link=topic=527356.msg3844228#msg3844228 date=1323484258]

I try to keep rsps away from java, as rsps is a disgrace to java, seeing as how badly MOST servers are horribly programmed, such as delta, but their are few good ones, such as apollo.

Well, I do enjoy coding Java more than RSPS, but i like the sM thing because it’s very short and for me easy to remember as i used to make Delta based servers constantly
[/quote]
RSPS is not a language. RuneScape Private Servers are written in Java (98% of the time). RSPS/Java are effectively the same thing.[/quote]

No, they aren’t.

One is an accumulation of the other.

It’s like calling elements and molecules the same thing.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

Since this is your own project then the amount of people caring about your bad habits is relatively small, however I suggest you work on fixing them if you think about releasing any sort of code, it helps readability loads.

item.title: Shortening system.out.println
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Send Message (sM) is a packet going from the server to the client. System.out.println is something printing out in the cmd box. Two totally different things, why try and make them the same thing? I would rather disambiguate them.

Read full topic

item.title: Shortening system.out.println
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

zyle1992:

Why the hell would you want to? It’s god damn confusing.

My opinion

[quote=“tyb97, post:16, topic:424692”][quote author=Native^ link=topic=527356.msg3843954#msg3843954 date=1323471990]
OR you could use a static import.

static import System.out;

out.println("");

[/quote]
I prefer this method.[/quote]
Your opinion

Read full topic

item.title: Shortening system.out.println
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

[quote=“The Outsider, post:12, topic:424692”]You have to create the method first then so it knows what you mean, but then that defeats the object of shortening it. Oh, in usage it would be shorter yes, but why not simply use “out(String);”

So much easier to type.[/quote]
Because i’m used to sM on Delta, so i changed it again to sM.sM(String);

Read full topic

item.title: Shortening system.out.println
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

You have to create the method first then so it knows what you mean, but then that defeats the object of shortening it. Oh, in usage it would be shorter yes, but why not simply use “out(String);”

So much easier to type.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“Native^, post:9, topic:424692”]OR you could use a static import.

[code=java]
static import System.out;

out.println("");
[/code][/quote]
It’s shortened to Snd.msg("")
